signature_drinks.description: Light, crisp, pale ale-style beer served in tiny 200ml cylindrical glasses called 'Stange.' About 25 different brands brewed only within Cologne city limits. Protected by strict regional appellation since 1986.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served by waiters called 'K√∂bes' in traditional gruff style. Your glass is continuously refilled until you place a coaster on top to signal you've had enough. The small glasses keep beer cold and fresh. The K√∂ln Guild of Brewers dates to 1396. K√∂lsch beer style appeared in 1800s.

signature_drinks.name: Eau de Cologne (K√∂lnisch Wasser)
signature_drinks.description: While not a drink, this world-famous perfume has been made in Cologne since 1709. Farina's original formula described as 'spring morning in Italy, mountain narcissus, and orange blossom after rain.'
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Not consumed, but the world's oldest perfume factory (operating since 1723) is a point of local pride. Both 'Farina' and '4711' brands are Cologne institutions.
